dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9607 IH: To prohibit States, local governments, or State regulatory authorities from prohibiting a natural gas consumer from connecting or reconnecting to a gas utility for natural gas service, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Jacobs of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To prohibit States, local governments, or State regulatory authorities from prohibiting a natural gas consumer from connecting or reconnecting to a gas utility for natural gas service, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: No State, local government, or State regulatory authority may prohibit a natural gas consumer from connecting or reconnecting to a gas utility for natural gas service.

paragraph.text: The terms State regulatory authority and gas utility have the meanings given such terms in section 302 of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 (15 U.S.C. 3202).
The term natural gas consumer has the meaning given the term gas consumer in section 302 of the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act of 1978 (15 U.S.C. 3202).
